headline: Should Improved West African Cocoa Harvest Prospects Prompt a Rethink for Mondelez (MDLZ) Investors?
summary: Recent rains in the Ivory Coast have improved cocoa crop prospects, with Mondelez International reporting a cocoa pod count in West Africa 7% above the five-year average, raising expectations for a larger harvest and putting downward pressure on cocoa prices. This development could impact input cost projections for chocolate producers, as supply conditions in key regions may offset concerns from declining cocoa production in Nigeria. We'll explore how improved crop prospects and expected...
